metadata.name: Sysmon Configuration Update
metadata.comment: Detects updates to Sysmon's configuration. Attackers might update or replace the Sysmon configuration with a bare bone one to avoid monitoring without shutting down the service completely

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\sysmon64.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\sysmon.exe'))) AND lower(device.desc) = lower('system activity monitor') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-c')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/c')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('–c')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('—c')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('―c'))))

output.summary: Detects updates to Sysmon's configuration. Attackers might update or replace the Sysmon configuration with a bare bone one to avoid monitoring without shutting down the service completely

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administrators might use this command to update Sysmon configuration. Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/sysmon
